intro: Olyra glaberrima var. humilis, commonly known as the small-flowered olyra, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Araceae, characterized by its distinctive inflorescence composed of a spadix and a spathe. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30-60 cm, with smooth, glabrous stems and heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered, producing a unique, often fragrant aroma. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid lowland forests.
